item.title: Report X-2025071333
item.description:
Report X-2025071333

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-09
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE. THE RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART AND PPE, DISCOVERED THE PACKAGE WAS A CORROSIVE HAZMAT. UTILIZING DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUBS AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025060503
item.description:
Report E-2025060503

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-24
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 24, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1814 was forked and released approximately 5-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI personnel patched one (1) damaged 55-gallon poly drum of Potassium Hydroxide 50% and placed it into one (1) 95-gallon poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the dock floor and utilized hand tools to collect all spent absorbents into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report X-2025062137
item.description:
Report X-2025062137

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-18
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT FOUND LEAKING. OUTER BOX WAS VISUALLY DISCOVERED STAINED IN APPEARANCE AND EMITTING A STRONG SOLVENT ODOR. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THE CAP ON 1 OF 4 AMBER GLASS LABORATORY BOTTLES WAS LOOSE BY ONE ROTATION, CAUSING APPROX ONE LITER OF THE LIQUID TO LEAK FROM THE BREACH AND INTO THE CARTON. THE INTERNAL PACKING MATERIAL CONSISTED OF MOLDED FIBERBOARD PARTITIONS AND THE OUTER CARTON WAS A DOUBLEWALL FIBERBOARD BOX, RATED AT 48 LBS/IN EDGE CRUSH TEST (ECT).

item.title: Report E-2025070378
item.description:
Report E-2025070378

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-17
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pail due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pail leaking. The released material impacted the trailer floor, and a second paint can. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The impacted containers were containerized into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025061749
item.description:
Report X-2025061749

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-15
  • City: EARTH CITY

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND HAZMAT PACKAGE DISCOVERED LEAKING. DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE PD4 FOR A LEAKING HAZMAT ON THEIR RERUN SLIDE. RESPONDER SHOWED UP WITH PPE ON AND FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. RESPONDER UTILIZED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL. LEAKING PACKAGE AND CONTAMINATED DEBRIS WERE PLACED INTO SPILL TUBS AND TRANSPORTED BACK TO DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025070269
item.description:
Report E-2025070269

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-13
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4321
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the concrete dock and estimated that two (2) quarts of material was released due to improper packing of one (1) 275-gallon poly IBC. No absorbents were needed because all of the spilled products had evaporated by the time the contractors arrived. Clean Harbors personnel located the cracked tote and began setting up for a tote transfer. One (1) 275-gallon poly IBC tote was generated from the tote transfer. One (1) drum of waste was generated containing cut up tote pieces and absorbents. The generated waste will remain onsite for the Dayton Freight Lines team to coordinate disposal

item.title: Report E-2025060468
item.description:

item.title: Report E-2025070215
item.description:
Report E-2025070215

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: SAINT LOUIS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 20:45 PM ET, XSL contacted the call center to report a spill that was found inside a trailer in St. Louis, MO. The spill consists of two separate products: 4-1-gallon metal pails of GC Epoxy Primer Red Part A, and 1-5-gallon metal bucket of Pumadeq Flex 31MV White, which were not packaged properly and came loose during transit, spilling 5 ounces each onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will clean the spills and place the GC Epoxy containers into a (1) 30-gallon plastic drum, and the Pumadeq will be placed into a separate 30 gallon plastic drum.

item.title: Report E-2025070211
item.description:
Report E-2025070211

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-11
  • City: MARSHFIELD
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 12000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 07:38 EST, ERTS was contacted by XPO (XSJ) about a cargo release. It was reported that due to a forklift incident, an unknown amount of 3M Furnace Black Acrylic Paint (hazardous - UN1993) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the trailer floor. The terminal has requested a contractor out for cleanup and containment due to the size and type spill. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons UN1993 3M Furnace Black Acrylic Paint product released to wooden trailer floor due to forklift puncture. The contractors used paint thinner, hotsy and regular pressure washer on the trailer floor. The waste was containerized into 55-gallon metal drum contains product, absorbent pads and trash from trailer floor, (1) 55-gallon metal drum contains wash water, product and paint thinner. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2025070189
item.description:
Report E-2025070189

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-09
  • City: SAINT PETERS
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one and a half (1.5) gallons of material released from two (2) 1-gallon metal pails inside a box due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. One (1) 10-gallon metal drum was used to containerize the damaged drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

He advised that due to improper loading at a previous terminal/dunnage, 1 TBLS of acid acetic glacial 210.92 onto the side of the drum. Based on the class 8 haz class ERTS recommended a contractor for dispatch, but the SCM, Bob Odom, approved terminal staff to overpack the damaged drum.

  • Description: At 1:34 AM ET, XSJ contacted the call center to report a spill that occurred inside of a trailer in Marshfield, MO. The spill consists of approximately 1 gallon of Truefuel 50 Fuel, which released from a (1) 1 gallon metal can due to excessive freight that crushed the can, spilling onto the trailer floor. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the terminal, who stated they will wipe the spill with absorbents and will place the waste into a 5-gallon plastic drum. Waste ID 239258-1 was generated.
